alert.note: Alert for Barnstable; Eastern Plymouth; Southern Bristol; Southern Plymouth; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 11:06PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Barnstable, southern Plymouth, southeastern Bristol and Newport Counties through 1230 AM EDT... At 1105 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wareham, or near Marion, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding and heavy rain in excess of 1 inch per hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... New Bedford, Fall River, Plymouth, Dartmouth, Newport, Marion, Middleborough, Wareham, Sandwich, Bourne, Somerset, Portsmouth, Middletown, Fairhaven, Tiverton, Westport, Carver, Lakeville, Acushnet, and Freetown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.

area.areaDesc: Barnstable; Eastern Plymouth; Southern Bristol; Southern Plymouth; Western Plymouth
